entry.title: Newsletter #88
entry.content:
Hello folks! It’s #TechThursday at #namshi

This week we held our first “lighting talks” session with a lot of new and useful insight on tools and libraries!

We also realease another oss library for nodejs mysql2-promise that is based on node-mysql2 and let you take advantage of client-side query prepare/escape, connection pooling and other features that are not in the node-mysql library. Thanks to Hossam for this!

And here is the list of awesome links we found this week!

  • Jest: painless javascript unit testing

  • The New Retirement Age Is Thirty

  • Meet the e-voting machine so easy to hack, it will take your breath away

  • REST vs SOAP, the difference between soap and rest

  • Geolocation API

  • The Other Side of HTML

  • Becoming a Better Programmer

  • React Native – The future is here

  • Flux Cargo-Culting

  • JSConf UY: Flux – Those who forget the past…

  • How we rebuilt our app on React and Dropwizard

  • Flywheel: Google’s Data Compression Proxy for the Mobile Web

  • An Introduction to Quantum Computing forNon-Physicists

  • Chrome continues to fall apart at brisk pace

  • Show HN: Ramjet.js â€“ Morph DOM elements into each other

  • UAE firms struggle to search applicants with technical skills

  • Docker Without Docker

  • How Blackfire leverages Docker

  • the creator of redis has just opensourced disque, an in-memory, distributed message broker

  • Zalando, searching for world-class engineers in Dublin

  • Versioned APIs with Express

  • “This is the fastest port scanner. It can scan the entire Internet in under 6 minutes, sending 10M packets/sec”

  • Pachyderm: A modern alternative to Hadoop
